intro: Fimbristylis ammobia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flatsedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. This species is typically found in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization. Fimbristylis ammobia plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
